TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DatePickerTextBox extends System.Windows.Controls.TextBox

Docs.summary: Represents the text input of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DatePickerTextBox control enables users to type a date directly into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker>.
## Customizing the DatePickerTextBox Control To apply the same property settings to multiple DatePickerTextBox controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property. You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance. For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). To see the parts and states that are specific to the DatePickerTextBox, see [DatePicker Syles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style. If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application. The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running. For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in Button control's default template and is set by using a . You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
